items.summary: I love that you just keep coming back for more humiliating defeat.

items.title: Sprinklers made Australia green. But what happens when the water runs out?
items.summary: Billions of litres of water are sprayed onto household gardens every day during summer, allowing cities to stay green. Now water is running low. Has the sprinkler had its day?

items.title: Elena Rybakina's Australian Open final win over Aryna Sabalenka proves she's no one-hit wonder
items.summary: A consistent and composed Elena Rybakina claims her maiden Australian Open title by beating world number one Aryna Sabalenka in a thriller three years after her breakout Wimbledon win.

items.title: Pat Cummins ruled out of T20 World Cup as Steve Smith snubbed despite strong form
items.summary: Pat Cummins will miss the T20 World Cup after failing to recover from his back injury, while Steve Smith, fresh from a blistering BBL cameo, isn't named in Australia's final 15-man squad.

items.title: Venezuela announces amnesty bill that could lead to mass release of political prisoners
items.summary: The government did not release the text of the bill on Friday, leaving it unclear who will qualify for release.

items.title: England cricketer Harry Brook says he lied about New Zealand nightclub incident to protect teammates
items.summary: England's ODI and T20 captain Harry Brook issues a statement admitting he lied over the nightclub incident on his side's tour of New Zealand last year, saying other teammates were present when he was hit by a bouncer.

items.title: Rybakina takes down Sabalenka in stunning Australian Open final
items.summary: Elena Rybakina wins the Australian Open with a stunning three-set victory over world number one Aryna Sabalenka, who loses in the final for the second straight year.

items.title: Former PM Kevin Rudd says he declined Epstein invitation after latest document dump
items.summary: The newly released Epstein documents show the New York sex offender sought a wide-ranging network of political and financial contacts, including former Australian prime minister Kevin Rudd.

items.title: Niels Vink wins Australian Open quad wheelchair singles title
items.summary: Paying tribute to his long-time mentor, Niels Vink claims the Australian Open quad wheelchair singles title for the first time.

items.title: Cricket NSW announces coach Greg Shipperd sacked from state, Sydney Sixers roles
items.summary: Legendary cricket coach Greg Shipperd is sacked from his dual state and BBL roles in a major shake-up at Cricket NSW.

items.title: Why is my migraine worse in summer?
items.summary: For people with migraine, summer can be a double-edged sword. You may be able to relax but glare, heat, and changes to sleeping and diet can make attacks more likely or more severe.

items.title: Myanmar election won by military-backed party in widely condemned poll marred by violence
items.summary: The military's political party wins the vote in a result regarded as a forgone conclusion, with critics arguing threats and violence forced people to the ballot box in a country wracked by civil war.

items.title: Mosman Park murder-suicide described as 'heartbreaking' by WA premier
items.summary: WA Premier Roger Cook says the deaths of a family of four at their Perth home in an apparent murder-suicide is both "heartbreaking" and "unimaginable".

items.title: Tyra Banks's 'hot ice cream' went viral. Don't expect to see it called that anymore
items.summary: Reviews have said it "tasted like soggy biscuits" and was "a weird sensation to sip through a straw". Taste aside, something bugged me. How can you call something ice cream if it's not iced?

items.title: Why Asian countries are joining Trump's Board of Peace
items.summary: Analysts say Asian countries such as Indonesia and Vietnam have signalled support for US President Donald Trump's new Board of Peace, not because they expect changes in Gaza, but to gain access to US trade.

items.title: First Nations people say 'silence' on alleged Perth bomb attack weighs heavily
items.summary: Underwhelming public responses in the wake of the alleged attack on an Invasion Day rally in Perth leave First Nations people across Australia feeling their "pain matters less".

items.title: Darwin Lord Mayor Peter Styles says NT Electoral Commission lost his election donations disclosure information
items.summary: Darwin's Lord Mayor, Peter Styles, says the Northern Territory Electoral Commission lost an envelope containing his campaign donations disclosure.

items.title: Journalist Don Lemon charged with federal civil rights crimes over anti-ICE church protest
items.summary: Former CNN news anchor Don Lemon enters a not guilty plea and is released from custody after being arrested during an anti-ICE protest he says he was covering as an independent journalist.

items.title: Prime minister and SA premier announce $800 million deal for 17,000 new homes
items.summary: Funding for water infrastructure, urban renewal projects and first-home buyer schemes has been announced in a partnership between the Commonwealth and the state government.

items.title: Farmers reeling as estimated $20 million in livestock perish in Victorian fires
items.summary: The fires wiped out swathes of farmland and killed tens of thousands of livestock.

items.title: Bruny Island to get childcare solution but too late for the Archers
items.summary: After fighting for years for a childcare solution for her community, Teisha Archer says the news it will be happening is "wonderful" — but will come too late to help her and others in her situation.

items.title: Kakadu National Park's Jabiru Airport slated for demolition from October
items.summary: Kakadu's main airport, which services a wide and remote corner of the Northern Territory, has been slated for demolition as the deadline for the nearby uranium mine's rehabilitation looms.

items.title: Fruit tree netting installations to increase over next decade as heatwaves persist
items.summary: Sales of netting to protect fruit crops from extreme weather have increased in the past five years as researchers warn heatwaves will continue to impact agriculture.

items.title: Millions of dollars projected for flood-affected north-west Queensland graziers to rebuild
items.summary: Graziers are looking at a tough few years and millions of dollars to restock cattle herds as recovery begins in outback Queensland after widespread flooding hit the north-west.

items.title: The tide takes away his work each day, but learning to let go has transformed this artist

items.title: It was an audacious idea for a Liberals-Greens government, but did anyone stop to ask what Canberra voters would think?

items.title: Aryna Sabalenka the Australian Open final favourite but Elena Rybakina pledges 'fight to the end'
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka and Elena Rybakina are poised for a heavyweight bout in the Australian Open women's singles final, a rematch of a the classic 2023 decider.

items.title: What we know about the suspected murder-suicide of a Perth family of four
items.summary: An entire family has been found dead in their own home — a mother, a father and their two teenage boys, with police describing the event as "highly distressing" and a "devastating tragedy".

items.title: Beckham saga is an age-old heartache with an uncomfortably modern twist
items.summary: Cutting ties with your parents isn't a new phenomenon but having it painstakingly documented across social media is a contemporary problem.

items.title: Crochet octopus toys bring tactile comfort to premature babies at Western Sydney NICUs

items.summary: Barry Wooden has spent decades trying to honour the lives of his son and four mates who died in a horror railway crossing crash 25 years ago.

items.title: Ensay's annual Mountain Calf Sale moved to Bairnsdale for animal welfare
items.summary: The tiny Victorian town of Ensay has proudly hosted the annual mountain calf sale for decades, but the yards will be empty this year.

items.title: Push for retailers to play role in 3D-printed gun crackdown after Bondi attack
items.summary: Hardware stores would report customers suspected of building 3D-printed guns to the authorities under fresh calls for corporate Australia to play a role in thwarting access to the deadly weapons

items.title: Catherine O'Hara from Home Alone and Schitt's Creek dies aged 71

items.title: To understand Melania Trump's movie we might need to follow the money

items.title: Mimili artists talk of Country, community, survival in remote APY Lands

items.title: Children living in makeshift tents in Gaza are dying from hypothermia
items.summary: Mohammed died from hypothermia while in his mother's arms after a cold night in Gaza. His family are one of hundreds of thousands of Gazans enduring harsh winter conditions in flimsy tents across the enclave.

items.title: Novak Djokovic hits out at critics after epic Australian Open win over Jannik Sinner
items.summary: After beating two-time defending champion Jannik Sinner in five gruelling sets, Novak Djokovic sets his sights on those who doubted whether he could still be an Australian Open contender.

items.title: Taylor Liberals' leading man as leadership spill looms
items.summary: One Liberal source told the ABC a challenge to Sussan Ley's leadership is now a "matter of when, not if".

items.summary: The US Department of Justice says it is releasing more than 3 million new documents from the "Epstein files", but Democrats question why millions more are being withheld.

items.title: Australian Open 2026: Alexander Zverev takes issue with Carlos Alcaraz's injury timeout during semifinal
items.summary: Alexander Zverev says he "didn't like" that Carlos Alcaraz was allowed a medical timeout for a cramp during their semifinal match.

items.title: Carlos Alcaraz downs Alexander Zverev in ultimate match of margins as Australian Open finally delivers epic

items.title: Albanese government urged to use careful diplomacy to defuse Darwin Port row with China
items.summary: Industry groups that suffered three years of damaging Chinese trade tariffs on products including barley are appealing to the federal government to exercise careful diplomacy to defuse tensions with China over the ownership of Darwin Port.

items.title: More than $370 million now allocated for Victorian bushfire recovery support
items.summary: The state and federal governments will substantially increase financial support for 23 Victorian local government areas devastated by bushfires this month.

items.title: Tim Picton's brother says seeing CCTV would be 'scarring for me forever'
items.summary: In his first interview since the death of his brother Tim, SA's Health Minister Chris Picton reflects on the profound emotional impact of the loss on their family, his reluctance to watch the CCTV footage, and his brother's inability to become an organ donor "because of the coronial process".

items.title: Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley for Liberal Party leadership
items.summary: The West Australian backbencher had made no secret of his desire to lead the Liberal Party but says he will not run against Sussan Ley next week, a move which could pave the way for Angus Taylor.

items.summary: New Zealand has declined Donald Trump's invitation to join his Board of Peace and is calling for "clarity" over the proposal. Here's where other countries stand.

items.summary: Families frayed by NDIS cuts are bracing for even more change ahead of a year that is set to reshape the scheme into something more sustainable, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

items.summary: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

items.title: Nine Radio sold for cut-price $56m to pub tycoon Arthur Laundy as it spends $850m on outdoor ad company QMS
items.summary: Arthur Laundy's Laundy Family Office acquires a network that includes Melbourne's top-rating talk station 3AW, Sydney's 2GB and outspoken conservative presenters such as Ben Fordham and Tom Elliott.

items.title: Sussan Ley issues ultimatum to David Littleproud as she announces temporary shadow ministry
items.summary: The under-fire Liberal leader has given seven existing frontbenchers carriage of the portfolios vacated by Nationals, with a threat to leader David Littleproud the arrangements could be made permanent.

items.title: Australia closely monitoring Nipah virus, no change to border control
items.summary: The federal government is closely monitoring an outbreak of Nipah virus in India but has not received any advice to tighten border controls at this stage.

items.title: Brisbane Lions coach Chris Fagan says Lachie Neale having his 'best pre-season in a long time'
items.summary: Lachie Neale has been in the spotlight all summer after giving up the Brisbane co-captaincy amid his highly-publicised marriage breakdown but the Lions brass believe the premiership winner is physically in the midst of his best pre-season in some years.

items.title: Coalition between ACT Greens and Canberra Liberals ruled out as Bob Brown supports discussions
items.summary: Despite having the support of a former leader, an unusual coalition between the ACT Greens and the Canberra Liberals has been ruled out.

items.title: Kevin Muscat's Shanghai Port one of nine Chinese Super League clubs hit with corruption sanctions
